speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about when you first started experiencing these symptoms - fever, headache, anorexia, fatigue, and malaise?

speaker: Patient
text: "I think it started about 3 days ago, after I ate a big bowl of ice cream. I remember thinking it was just a stomach bug, but the headache has been really bad and I've been feeling so weak and tired all the time."

speaker: Doctor
text: When did these symptoms start, and did you experience them immediately after your last prenatal checkup, or were they present before that?

speaker: Patient
text: "I think they started a couple of days after my last prenatal checkup, but to be honest, I wasn't really paying attention to them at the time. It wasn't until I had that bowl of ice cream that I started to feel really off, and by that point, the fever and headache were already there, but I didn't think much of it."

speaker: Doctor
text: "When were the symptoms first noticeable to you, and can you tell me if you've experienced any other unusual symptoms, such as abdominal pain, joint pain, or changes in your vision or hearing?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Honestly, I haven't really noticed anything else out of the ordinary, just the fever, headache, and feeling really weak. I did have a bit of a stomach ache after eating the ice cream, but that could've been the ice cream itself, I guess."

speaker: Doctor
text: I'd like to examine your neck and throat for any signs of lymphadenopathy or inflammation.

speaker: Patient
text: "Okay, I don't really know what to expect, but I'm a little worried about my pregnancy, so I'm hoping everything checks out."

speaker: Doctor
text:

Also, can you tell me when your last prenatal checkup was, and if you've noticed any changes in your urine output or any unusual spotting since then?

text:
It seems the patient has been experiencing these symptoms for about 2 weeks now, and they started before the last prenatal checkup. They've had a fever for about a week, and the rest of the symptoms have been lingering. 

Can you tell me more about your usual routine and any changes you've made to it recently, such as traveling, eating differently, or taking any new supplements?



Also, I'd like to take a closer look at your liver, can you please lift your top for me to examine your right lower quadrant more thoroughly?

text:

"No, I haven't experienced any vomiting recently, but I did feel a bit nauseous after eating the ice cream, but it wasn't severe."

text:
"I usually eat a pretty balanced diet, with lots of fruits and vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins. I try to stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water throughout the day. speaker: Doctor
text: I've reviewed all the information and I'm ready to make a diagnosis. Based on the patient's symptoms and test results, I'm going to say that the patient has a diagnosis of acute cholecystitis, which is an inflammation of the gallbladder.
